name: Holiday Inn Express Grand Canyon

reviews.text: Comfortable beds and good value for money. Breakfast was included and is very good. Very convenient for visiting the Grand Canyon and we even saw elk near the hotel. Apparently they walk through this town frequently.
reviews.title: Great room

reviews.text: We would definitely use this hotel again.
reviews.title: Adequate

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rooms are dated and a bit worn. The place is a little dingy, like a Holiday Inn from the 70's that has not been updated. Not terrible, but not particularly pleasant. Very good breakfast, very large menu selection. The breakfast room is large, crowded, and like a college dorm breakfast room. Close to Grand Canyon is the only reason to stay here.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel

reviews.text: We booked thru Orbitz and, after reading the confirmation, found that there was no cancellation. This was a surprise. We booked 5 other hotels thru the hotels themselves on this trip and each one allowed for a cancellation.
reviews.title: Very small DIRTY room

likes.liked: — Location, but there are other choices that have just as good as a location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked a mini suite which is in a separate building from the main hotel. The room was very nicely decorated and very clean. The room appeared to be recently updated. The hotel provided a breakfast set up in a room which was adequate.
reviews.title: Fien for a short stay

reviews.text: We stayed one night in a comfortable, clean and quiet room big enough for 2 adults + 2 children.
reviews.title: Fine for a night

reviews.text: We were checked in by the manager, who was very friendly and efficient given the number of people she must have had to deal with throughout the day.
reviews.title: One of the better values in a captive market

reviews.text: The following morning we went to get some breakfast at the undersized and overcrowded room off the lobby. It was a less than satisfactory experience as others have pointed out, but we were lucky enough to be invited to share a table outside with another family. We just couldn't face going back in for anything more after our coffee and bagel.
reviews.title: Construction outdoors, a zoo in the AM, property too big for itself, terrible internet

reviews.text: As I had promised the kids, we went to the hotel's pool before leaving. It was very nice, and we had the place to ourselves. A real plus for families.
reviews.title: Worth the money

reviews.text: Check out was smooth and again carried out cheerily by the manager from the night before.
reviews.title: Pricey but then you're paying for the location

reviews.text: Pro:
reviews.title: Adequate

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 15-minute drive to South Rim
reviews.title: Nice and comfortable

likes.disliked: — The cost was a little more than usual, but again, location...

reviews.text: Close to helicopters
reviews.title: Great stay

likes.liked: — The comfortable beds and the closeness to the helipad
likes.disliked: — Would of liked a bigger bathroom/vanity area.

reviews.text: Close to imax theather
reviews.title: Only good for a one night stay

likes.liked: — grand canyon was very close to the hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Free breakfast
reviews.title: Did The Job !!

reviews.text: Hotel location is very close to park and near everything you'll need while visiting the Canyon. Indoor pool was disappointing. High-priced for a Holiday Inn but little choice for much else.
reviews.title: Great location. What you'd expect from Holiday Inn/

reviews.text: Located just outside the Grand Canyon Park, check in was friendly and welcoming with information provided. Rooms were of good size, well air conditioned.
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel

reviews.text: Breakfast quick and easy, plenty of car parking, free internet and newspaper
reviews.title: Comfortable and Close

reviews.text: We stayed here for three nights when we visited the Grand Canyon. The room was fine, fairly large, comfortable beds and nice pillows. It had a pool, but we were too tired to use it! The staff is extremely friendly, they speak everytime they see you! It was a comfortable place to come home to and rest. Internet was fine, but it worked better plugged in than as wireless, for some reason. Would stay there again.
reviews.title: We'd definitely stay here again! :)

reviews.text: We usually stay at one of the lodges in the Grand Canyon - which we absolutely love. Unfortunately, this year, we did not make the reservations soon enough and were unable to stay in the Canyon itself. However, we were VERY pleased with the Holiday Inn Express at the Grand Canyon. It was a beautiful hotel, in a great location that has nice, clean & quiet rooms and a delicious breakfast. It was a great start to a wonderful two days at the Grand Canyon! :) We would definitely stay at the Holiday Inn Express at the Grand Canyon again!
reviews.title: much better than expected, best hotel in town?

reviews.text: We were unable to get accomadations within the Grand Canyon park, so I thought a Holiday Inn would be a decent second choice. The location at Tusayan is very convenient, as it is about a 20 minute drive from the hotel to the park. That was the only great thing about this hotel. The lobby was good, but the hotel is older and our rooms were very drab. we were on vacation with our daughter and grand daughter and I had booked two rooms for our party. My daughter had dirty towels in her bathroom and would not shower there. Our room was okay, but as I said, the hotel is older and is showing signs of age. I had some questions about the Grand Canyon and the hotel staff was very helpful. However, on the day we were to check out, housekeeping knocked at my daughter's door at 8:00 am to see if they could clean the room. Not cool. They were eager to get into ours as well. I know the hotel was completely booked, but that is not good customer service. Breakfast was included in the price of the hotel and was standard fare. We were on a two week road trip. This hotel was the most expensive and was definitely not worth the money we paid for our rooms. I would not stay here again.
reviews.title: We Won't be Back!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location at the entrance of the Grand Canyon National Park is very good, you can rach the rim within a few minutes by car. The room was fairly large and calm. The breakfast buffet was very large and particularly the fruit and juice offerings were amazing!
reviews.title: Great location - fair price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Service was always very good and staff was very friendly. They gave us hints for visiting the Grand Canyon in the early morning in order to get the best pictures and impressions.
reviews.title: Ask and you will receive.

reviews.text: Can definitely recommend this location if you don't want to invest even more money just for staying closer to the rim (e.g. at El Tovar) and even though get very good service, food and ambience at a much more convenient price.
reviews.title: nice and good deal
Great Location
reviews.text: We had seen this hotel several years earlier when we stayed across the street from it and were sorry we hadn't selected it. This time we did and were very happy. We had asked for a quiet unit, king bed, internet service, coffee maker and microwave and they delivered. They assigned us to a stand-alone building located away from the main street and away from their lobby (where all the tour buses discharge hords of passengers).

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very Surprised that the Grand Canyon area did not have more hotels available.
reviews.title: One of Nicest Hotels in the area

reviews.text: Not cheap for what it is but it's about location, and it's minutes from the Grand Canyon. The room was clean and everything you would expect. Self-service breakfast was fine. Coffee was available from very early in the morning; about 4am, for all the early risers. It advertises wi-fi in every room, but our signal was too weak. We used it in the lobby, which was still a bit slow. Judging by the number of other people sat in the lobby with their tablets and laptops, we weren't alone in having a problem.
reviews.title: Location is great. Everything else is fine.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There were no vacancies on the night we stayed so worth booking ahead.
reviews.title: Easy Access to Grand Canyon

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We just returned from a trip to the Grand Canyon. We decided to stay just outside the canyon thinking it would be easier with the crowds. It turned out to be a great idea. Our room was clean and roomy and a great location. Right across the street from the hotel is the stop for the shuttle that goes into the park so it made it very easy and convenient. The breakfast at the hotel was adequate, nothing fancy, but that's what we expected from a Holiday Inn. What was important to us was that it was clean, quiet, and the price was right!
reviews.title: Clean Room & Great Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were suprised and pleased by the warm and professional greeting at the front desk. The young lady cared! We were upgraded to a suite. The room was as expected, clean and everything worked. It was an uneventful, yet pleasant visit.
reviews.title: happily stay there again though a bit noisy on the ground floor

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Check in quick and easy arrived a little early than the stated time of 4pm and checked in at 3pm with no problems. Booked a mini suite 2 months in advance which was like new and had a small balcony. Room clean and included fridge microwave and coffee/ tea making facilities, as well as 2 flat screen tvs although reception on the channels not too good. Location 5 minutes walk from main street in Tuysan where we could find only a few restaurants to choose from but ample for the 2 nights we stayed. With a 5 minute drive to the entrance to the park really good overall location. Remember the temperatures are a lot cooler than Vegas and take a jumper/ jacket. We were there June 5th and temperatures dipped to around 5 degress in the morning warming to about 20centigrade in the afternoon. ( the hotel staff did list the daily temperatures by the lift) As the suites are seperate from the main hotel at breakfast had no problems as there was always a table free to sit down, with cereals, yogurts, bagels, omlettes, bacon, muffins bannanas eat as much as you like, with fruit juices, tea and coffee available too which was a great as included in the price.
reviews.title: Excellent room and value

likes.liked: — Really comfy bed especially after all that walking!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Continental breakfasts were decent and filling. Indoor pool was nice. The bed was exceptionally comfortable. We'd stay at a Holiday Inn Express again.
reviews.title: Good Place..

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed only for one night so we could visit the Grand Canyon. This hotel met all of our needs. The room was comfortable and clean. The breakfast supplied in the morning was fantastic and a rare thing to find while holidaying in America. We found the staff friendly and helpful. It is very close to the entrance of the South Rim and a direct trip back to Vegas (4.5hrs).
reviews.title: Great Place to View the Grand Canyon!!!!!!

likes.liked: — The distance to the South Rim

reviews.text: There was no line for check-in at the Holiday Inn at 6pm on a Saturday. The hotel was very nice! The location of our room wasn't the best, however. It was right next to the lobby & right across form the Breakfast room. Lots of noise in the hallway, but none from the room next door. The hotel had no vacancies; they were turning people away. The free breakfast was pretty extensive & quite good! They had cheese omelettes, bacon, cinnamon rolls, donuts, bagels, english muffins, cereal, & yogurt plus coffee, milk & fruit juice. The first morning they had no fruit out & the second morning they had some bananas, but they were green & not edible! On Sunday morning breakfast was crowded but on Monday it was packed. We had to wait for a table on Monday, but only a few minutes. My mom & dad's wheelchair accessible room was very nice, complete with a roll in shower & a bath seat. There is no restaurant in this hotel, but plenty close by on Hwy 64. I would not hesitate to stay there again.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, great location!

reviews.text: We drove from Sedona to the Canyon on June 14 2008 and stayed at the Holiday Inn Express, all I can say is, GROSS! The hotel offers very little, no internet, no laundry and the bathroom in room 354 smelled like urine. The hotel has no food, except the breakfast buffet which is like a free-for-all! Crowds of people swarm the free cereal and pasteries like it's their last meal! Save yourself, if you have the means go to the Best Western, or the Grand.
reviews.title: DIRTY & LOUD

likes.disliked: — filthy dirty and loud door slams in the morning

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is on the main road just down from the park entrance, its easy to find and convient for the Grand Canyon.
reviews.title: Good Value, okay hotel, great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Its a slightly older hotel, so the decor and fixtures and fittings are showing some wear, and the new 'hot' breakfast leaves something to be desired - though this is common across the Holiday Inn Express', even if they do vary quite a bit.
reviews.title: The suites were nice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The best thing about this hotel is its price for its location - its really good value this close to the park, and no one should be staying here to 'use' the hotel, for a bed for the night it is perfect.
reviews.title: Great location, good price

likes.liked: — The location, cleanliness, and hot breakfast

reviews.text: I booked a single night in one of the suites with Holiday Inn points (same # of points as a regular room). If you have the chance, get one of the suites. The suites were in a separate building with its own hottub and breakfast room. The suite itself was just OK. The bed was wonderful and the pillows great like any Holiday Inn Express. The room itself was a bit dated, but thats ok with me. We also had a tiny balcony. The balcony was nice for drying bathing suits or when you need to step-outside for some air. Additionally, the suits have a separate sitting area with its own HDTV and a wet-bar area with a small sink, small fridge, microwave, and coffee pot. The location was nice, under 10 minutes from the park entrance, walking distance to the IMAX and a couple of restaurants.
reviews.title: Met expectations

likes.disliked: — No probelms with any aspect of the stay

reviews.text: That all said, the best part of the suites was the separate building that was key coded to enter. A lot of tour buses use the Holiday Inn as an overnight stop, but they stay in the main building. But by staying in the other building, you have far less crowds at breakfast and no kids running up and down the halls all night.
reviews.title: Not a good value

aka: Holiday Inn Express Grand Canyon Hotel
description: The Grand Canyon Holiday Inn Express Hotel & Suites features 164 guest rooms and a 32 suite room annex. Free in-room high speed Internet access is available. We are entirely a non-smoking hotel. The Holiday Inn Express Hotel & Suites is located one mile from the Grand Canyon National Park South Rim entrance. Dining and entertainment within walking distance. 1/2 mile from the Grand Canyon Airport and Helibase. Air tours, jeep rides, raft trips, can be arranged from the hotel. Free continental breakfast from 6:30 am to 9:30 am. KidSuites Available for 2 adults and three children - Queen rooms have 4 person max, and King Rooms have 2 person max. Visit Grand Canyon, AZ and Stay Smart at the Holiday Inn Express Hotel & Suites.
